definition[0]: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance
example[0]: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
example[1]: The show is timed to coincide with the launch of a new book.
example[2]: His entry to the party coincided with his marriage.
definition[1]: if two peopleâ€™s ideas, opinions etc coincide, they are the same
example[3]: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
example[4]: The cloth had a natural look which coincided perfectly with the image Laura sought.
definition[2]: to meet or be in the same place
example[5]: The journey coincides in part with the Pennine Way.
